definition: trap/snare/trick
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
pen (pig)/a fold
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)
to fall in a trap
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people

sentences.english: He was right, of course, to avoid the mayoralty trap.
sentences.chinese: 當然，他躲開了市長這個圈套倒是正確的。

sentences.english: The americans decided penkovsky was a provocation.
sentences.chinese: 美國人認定潘科夫斯基的事是一種圈套。

sentences.english: Som boon leelathitikul slowly fall into the trap.
sentences.chinese: 李大山慢慢落入了圈套。

sentences.english: The police set traps to make him confess.
I used only EQ, compression and a touch of reverb on the snare and overheads.
sentences.chinese: 我唯一的EQ，壓縮和混響的圈套和間接接觸。

sentences.english: She put a loop of rope around the cow's neck.
sentences.chinese: 她把繩圈套在了奶牛的脖子上。

sentences.english: To evaluate the therapeutic value of endoscopic band ligation in gastric stromal tumors.
sentences.chinese: 探討內鏡下皮圈套扎術對胃間質瘤的治療價值。

sentences.english: I'm stuck in a rut and I need to get out of it quick.
sentences.chinese: 我被騙進去一個圈套中，我必須儘快的出來。

sentences.english: In pain, the bird-catcher threw down his trap, and the noise made the Dove take wing.
sentences.chinese: 在痛苦，鳥類捕手扔了他的圈套，和噪聲採取了鴿翼。

sentences.english: When you buy something with zero percent interest, there’s a catch.
sentences.chinese: 當你用零利率購買東西的時候，這裏面肯定有個圈套。

sentences.english: Make traps to catch small animals.
sentences.chinese: 設計圈套去捕捉微小的動物。

sentences.english: Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation.
sentences.chinese: 觀察並祈禱以防止你掉入誘惑的圈套。

sentences.english: They trapped her into telling where the gift was hidden.
sentences.chinese: 他們設了圈套，讓她說出了禮物藏在什麼地方。

sentences.english: The King was planning a trap for the official to fall into.
sentences.chinese: 這位國王要設計圈套讓他掉進去。

sentences.english: When my friend Melot set the trap, I think I knew it.
sentences.chinese: 當我的朋友梅洛特設下圈套，我想我是知道的。

sentences.english: Nature's way of tricking people into reproducing.
sentences.chinese: 大自然爲了使人類生生不息而設的圈套。

definition: pitfall/snare/trap
evil plan/evil schemes
trick/ruse/crafty scheme
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to set a trap
to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
plot/conspiracy
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
to walk right into the trap
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
